Description: Fragment of sandstone temple-relief carved with a scene showing an ithyphallic god (Amun of Karnak), standing with one arm raised and a flail above. The god wears a tall feathered headdress and is facing right. Behind him is a standing goddess wearing the Red Crown and between the two figures is a shrine topped by lettuces ? and a lotus. In front of each figure there are hieroglyphic texts written vertically at the top and bottom of the scene, the lower texts record 'donation' speeches by the deities. All in low relief. Fragments of a text on the left edge are also preserved.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: Dr George Witt
Findspot: Found/Acquired: Karnak (Thebes), See Comments field for attribution by Beinlich; also correspondence 7/12/04, from J Hallof and 6/6/05 from H. Beinlich.
Curator's comments: Horst Beinlich identifies this as part of Ptolemy VIII's decoration at the temple of Ra-Horakhty. see PM II: Pl.18 (40 a-d): north doorjamb, second register. cf. Urk VIII: 124, no.160. see Beinlich & Hallof, Einfuehrung in das Wuerzburger Datenbanksystem SERaT (2007), 55. Also correspondence 7/12/04 and 10/12/04 from J Hallof.
